author: daxian-dbw
body:
A test failure related to `Test-Connection` is found in CI runs in the master branch and PR.
This test failure was seen in the CI build in the master branch after #6612 was merged.
Then it's seen again in the CI runs for PR #6660.

Build: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/v6.1.0-preview.9044

```
TEST FAILURES
Description: Force IPv4 with explicit PingOptions
Name:        Test-Connection.Ping.Force IPv4 with explicit PingOptions
message:
Expected exactly '8.8.8.8', but got 0.0.0.0.
stack-trace:
at <ScriptBlock>, C:\projects\powershell\test\powershell\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Management\Test-Connection.Tests.ps1: line 98
98:             $result1.Replies[0].Address              | Should -BeExactly $realAddress
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
The test uses external resources so it can sometimes fall. We seen the same while the web cmdlet tests used httpbin.org - WebListener solved this. 
We need to create a network emulator to solve this problem.

title: Test-Connection Force IPv4 with explicit PingOptions test failing on Linux platforms
